Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Bridal \Brid"al\, a. [From {Bride}. Cf. {Bridal}, n.] Of or pertaining to a bride, or to wedding; nuptial; as, bridal ornaments; a bridal outfit; a bridal chamber. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Bridal \Brid"al\, n. [OE. bridale, brudale, AS. br[=y]dealo brideale, bridal feast. See {Bride}, and {Ale}, 2.] A nuptial festival or ceremony; a marriage. [1913 Webster]
Sweet day, so cool, so calm, so bright, The bridal of the earth and sky. --Herbert. [1913 Webster]

bridal adj 1: of or relating to a wedding; "bridal procession"; "nuptial day"; "spousal rites"; "wedding cake"; "marriage vows" [syn: {nuptial}, {spousal}] 2: designed for a bride; "bridal gown" n : archaic terms for a wedding or wedding feast [syn: {espousal}]
